comments: Smallest prime of form (n^2)*k+1, i.e. an arithmetic progression with n^2 differences; k is the subscript of the progressions.
links: Index entries for sequences related to primes in arithmetic progressions
example: a(5)=101 because in 5^2k+1=25k+1 progression k=4 generates the smallest prime *this is 101) and 26,51 and 76 are composite.
crossrefs: Analogous case is A034694. Special case is A002496.
author: _Labos Elemer_
